intro: Galeopsis ionantha, commonly known as lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with glandular hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in whorled clusters, which are often mistaken for insects due to their appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Galeopsis ionantha is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
